reviewText: There is a lot to like here.  Kristi and Erin are pleasant and upbeat, Erin explains the exercises clearly, Erin tells you what the exercises are doing for your body, and the workouts are challenging.  The first time I did this, I gave up halfway through and just watched.  Workouts 2 and 3 have lots of planks, side planks, and intense cardio.  The second time, I just did the warm up and Workout 1.  Workout 1 is doable for beginners and the cardio steps are not complicated (I've never done an aerobics class and am a bit uncoordinated).  I didn't like the cool down much-I thought there should have been more of a transition from the intense cardio to sitting on the floor and stretching. Overall, a great workout and I look forward to being able to do Workouts 2 and 3.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I guess I'm in the minority of people who disliked this dvd.First off,let me say that I hate grapevines and when this dvd started with them I thought,UGH!!!!!!!!!!The sculpting was good but I disliked the cardio-mainly because I just despise those grapevines!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Just finished this workout and liked it a lot.  On this DVD, Kristi works with Erin O'Brien, who demonstrates the moves.  I like Erin O'Brien from her own DVDs and she's equally good on this one, giving solid cues and tips for proper form.  Kristi and Erin's chatter is encouraging without being annoying.  The workout is broken into sections: a warm up, 3 10 minute circuits which start with cardio and then move to strength exercises, a short cardio wrap up which puts all the cardio moves together, a short core workout, and a stretch and cool down.  You can choose individual sections or combine all for close to an hour workout.  The cardio is strong but includes both high impact and low impact alternatives.  This was a good, enjoyable total body workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Kristi and Erin really keep you moving, with excellent instructions and motivation; a total body workout and fun. I workout with friends to this DVD and all enjoy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: As a huge fan of Erin O'Brien's Strong Body, Ageless Body, I ordered this DVD mostly because her newer workout Strong Body, Fit Body looks really hard, and this seemed like a good middle between the two. I gotta say I'm happy with this workout.It's split into three circuit sections, the first 5 minutes being a cardio routine and the second five weights. Then there's a five minute set where you put together all the cardio, a ten minute set of floor work, and a stretch segment.  There's some difficult moves, but nothing too difficult--it helps that O'Brien seems to know when something's burning and lets you know that it's almost over instead of just going on and on with no commentary like a lot of other instructors.  I of course love her as an instructor, and Yamaguchi is helpful in this as well, offering up tougher modifications.My only thing is that, if you want to enjoy this the most, make sure you have a bigger space. I did this in my tiny apartment living room and was wishing I could jump around and travel a little more. Also, I HATE lunges...I know they're effective, but uuarughhh. There's a lunge-heavy segment on this thing that I DREAD.All in all, a solid workout. Erin O'Brien is great.
summary: Good, but make sure you have some space
Title: N/A

reviewText: I want to start by saying the workout itself is pretty great.  Erin O'Brien has become one of my favorite fitness instructors over the past couple of months.  The only problem is that I have issues with my wrists which make part of this DVD too difficult to do.Workout 1 is fine.  Workout 2 requires some plank work that can't be modified by going to your forearms since it's a plank to a downward dog.  Workout 3 also has some plank work but this can be modified with a forearm plank.  Usually when a workout is too hard on my wrists, I give it a lower review, but I think this DVD is so good that I couldn't bring myself to dock it more than one star.As others have mentioned, the dynamic between Kristi and Erin seems a little strained and fake, but if you concentrate on the workout you will be sweating.  Each of the 3 10-min workouts starts with about 5 minutes of cardio followed by 5 minutes of sculpting/strength training.  Then there is a 4 minute power workout where you combine all the cardio moves and finally some core stuff.  My review is strictly on the 3 10-minute workouts and the power workout - I haven't done the core part of this DVD yet.  What I did was tough enough.I think this is worth the investment (although I got mine with a Warehouse Prime deal so it was under $10). I do, however, wish there was a feature where you could choose your workout and create your own combinations.  It's unfortunate that this isn't an option, but it doesn't make or break my desire to do this DVD again.Watch the video on Amazon (it's from the first 10-min workout) and decide for yourself, but definitely be wary if you have any type of carpal tunnel or difficulty weight-bearing on your hands/wrists.
summary: Bad Wrists = Bad Choice, but Overall a Solid DVD

Title: N/A

reviewText: As you may surmise from my review title, I am an Erin O'Brien fan. :-D I think her workouts are safe, sound, and effective for all but truly advanced exercisers, and for me they are also great fun! Be advised that they are in no way "hard core" (Jillian she's not!) but they're generally appropriate - or modifiable - for most ages, levels and abilities.Although this particular DVD falls under Kristi's name it's very much an Erin workout, although this time it's a cardio/sculpt routine. As with Erin's other workouts this DVD is not glitzy, glamorous or over-produced. A simple home-like setting, basic music background to keep the beat (but for some reason doesn't bore me through repeat viewings as most videos do) and a minimum of equipment required. Don't forget to gently increase your weight load over time. Erin cautions not to exceed 8-pound dumbbells with all her videos, but I use different weights for different exercises and sometimes use 10. ;)Others have pointed out that legs are not heavily addressed in this video, but if you alternate this with Erin's other circuit programsStrong Body, Ageless Body with Erin O'BrienandStrong Body Fit Bodyyou will resolve that issue. Using all three weekly gives one a nicely balanced variety of exercises and strength-training modalities. Just add some cardio with yoga or stretching on the alternating days and see what happens!
summary: Great fun, effective and balances an Erin O'Brien rotation
Title: N/A
